etymology.description: Depicts a ceremonial hat with a flat top and broad brim -> symbolic of authority and rank
etymology.interpretation: The character 冕(miǎn, 'ceremonial hat') illustrates the structure and appearance of a traditional ceremonial hat, which served as a symbol of authority and rank in ancient China.

examples.chinese: 皇帝头戴冕(皇帝頭戴冕)。
examples.english: The emperor wears a ceremonial hat.

examples.chinese: 古时宫廷礼仪森严(古時宮廷禮儀森嚴)，官员参加登基典礼时必须佩冕(官員參加登基典禮時必須佩冕)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshí gōngtíng lǐyí sēn yán, guānyuán cānjiā dēngjī diǎnlǐ shí bìxū pèi miǎn.
examples.english: In ancient times, when palace rituals were strict, officials had to wear the hat during enthronement ceremonies.

examples.chinese: 学者研读史书时常提及帝王冕(學者研讀史書時常提及帝王冕)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yándú shǐshū shícháng tíjí dìwáng miǎn.
examples.english: Scholars often refer to the imperial hat when studying historical texts.
